{"step_by_step_thinking": "Immunization data is typically collected through health surveys. A sample registration system would not necessarily provide this information, as it is not specifically focused on health or immunization data. A rural survey might provide some information, but it would not cover the entire community, especially urban areas. Census data is more about population count and demographics, not specific health data. A district level health survey, on the other hand, is designed to collect health-related data, including immunization rates, from a broad and representative sample of the community.", "answer_choice": "B"}
